intro: Tricalysia lasiodelphys subsp. lasiodelphys, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, bright red or orange flowers. The plant has a distinctive trunk with a rough, fissured bark and produces pods that contain flat, winged seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
